text: Jean de Heinzelin de Braucourt (6 August 1920 - 4 November 1998) was a Belgian geologist who worked mainly in Africa. He worked at the universities of Ghent and Brussels. He gained international fame in 1960 when he discovered the Ishango Bone. ==References== *Biography at the Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences Accessed January 2007 Category:Belgian geologists Category:1920 births Category:1998 deaths Category:20th-century geologists
title: Jean de Heinzelin de Braucourt
